cards.title: Intro
cards.pre: Welcome to this introduction course! As this is only a demo of CyBooks course offerings, this lesson will be very fast-paced and may not cover everything in precise detail.
cards.mid-text: This page covers CSS, or Cascading Style Sheets. It's used to define how an HTML document is rendered and has lots ofoptions for controlling layout. It is a significantly complex layout engine. Let's dive in!
cards.post: We hope you enjoy the lesson!

cards.title: Box model
cards.pre:
In CSS, every element has a set of properties that help specify layout. These properties include:
  • Margin
  • Border
  • Padding
cards.mid-text:
Margin controls the space around the element and is always transparent.
Border can be used to draw a visible border around any element.
Padding is used to add a little bit of space between the border and any content inside the element.

cards.title: Colors
cards.pre: There are several ways to represent colors in CSS.
cards.mid-text: Many colors have their own names. Some examples are red, olive, or firebrick. Alternatively, they can be specified using hexidecimal values by using a hashtag, such as #2675BF. Other options include RGBA (red, green, blue, and alpha) or HSB (hue, saturation, brightness), which are used with functions instead, such as rgba(180, 68, 125, 1)
